title: albon
author: albon
content: Hello guys,A new and risky AI feature released by the HeyGen platform is the ultra-realistic avatar feature. What is it:HeyGen is a video platform that helps anyone to create engaging business videos with generative AI as quickly as making PowerPoints for various use cases.How it works:1- You choose an avatar or create your own avatar2- You use a voice from the 300 voices available in more than 40 languages3- You Submit to generate so that your video is made in minutesFor Example:Video clips of Joshua Xu, Co-founder and CEO of HeyGen, were generated 100% by AI. The videos included his own avatar and the voice clone with massive improvements to his lifestyle avatar quality to match his unique accent and speech pattern are so perfectly distinguished that no one would know that it was made by artificial intelligence and not a fake video.Check out Joshua's Avatar 2.0 video clips: https://twitter.com/joshua_xu_/status/1689019874667024384Conclusion:This feature may be wrongly used by scammers to steal and deceive their victims, from the perspective of video verification, AI is now really scary and easily believable, so do not send your coins to anyone, no matter who they are, even if you see Elon Musk or CZ or others, Do not believe the videos and everything you see or hear.Source:[1] https://www.heygen.com/[2] https://twitter.com/HeyGen_Official[3] https://twitter.com/joshua_xu_

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Your image screenshot is perfectly taken. I clicked on the image to play the video, forgetting that the forum doesn't allow video clips.Quote from: albon on August 11, 2023, 05:20:41 PMThis feature may be wrongly used by scammers to steal and deceive their victims, from the perspective of video verification, AI is now really scary and easily believable, so do not send your coins to anyone, no matter who they are, even if you see Elon Musk or CZ or others, Do not believe the videos and everything you see or hear.It's not about being wrongly used and all of that, as scammers are already using it right now. I don't know if this app is the actual one they use, but I have seen some similar AI videos generated in which they match the face and body movements of the person they are impersonating, using that means to convince their victims that they are actually real. The more new technologies are being developed and introduced daily for the advancement and betterment of human life, the more scammers are also busy looking for ways to turn that into their own advantage. We all just need to be careful on the internet, where new convicting methods of scamming are emerging day by day.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Domain is 7 years old, means website might too if not shifted from another domain to this one. Means the platform is not something new but we all should be aware of such tools because if one not know about it then he or she might fall prey into the hands of scammers or fake videos. I checked the about us section and the CEO was a employee at Snapchat (we all know what is snapchat) he worked there for 6 years. And now he made his own project which has more than 3 million monthly users. I am wondering what would be people using these services for, instead of ads campaigns, or marketing etc. Because fake faces worth less then real ones so it must become cost effective for the agencies to hire a fake AI face instead of real one for marketing purposes. Well, i read some reviews and the use cases are a lot but as you are trying to shed light on scam side so definitely it could be used to scam others too. So, we have to be careful from such activities.

It was believable because Elon musk video was on display on YouTube live using a different channel, his lips movements and sound were that of him. But, after I checked the age of the domain I found out that it was created that day, I did bookmark the site but I’m currently not on my laptop and as for the YouTube channel and video it has been taken down by YouTube.So there are so many unethical ways this could be used aside from scammers using it.

comments.body: Well, the tech is not really new. People need to be conscious of what they put on the internet. It will be hard for the AI to properly imitate someone with little to no personal data (like video/audio/pic of hisher face, voice, etc)on the internet. When you understand that the internet is like a mind or brain and anything you expose on it is monitored, absorb and learned by program in the brain, you would be more careful what you feed it. In the end, such personal data will be used to understand you, imitate you, create your replica and mostly used to deceive... For example, they could create a hologram or something called "familiar spirit" and use it in place of you after you leave this world, to lie to your relatives that it's you or that it's your spirit or their ancestor. Your replica could be continously cloned/developed and powered by your familiar spirit/AI. Your robot replica would be powered by AI while your clone is powered by evil spirit(aka familiar spirit). And that would mean you live forever in their world whereas it's just a fake/replica of you.
